conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the electric force experienced by the small ball at point B.
Electric field at point B due to charges +Q at M and -Q at N can be calculated using superposition.
Distance from B to M and from B to N is L as M, N, and B form an equilateral triangle.
Electric field due to a point charge Q at a distance r is E = kQ/r^2.
Electric field at B due to charge +Q at M is E_M = kQ/L^2.
Electric field at B due to charge -Q at N is E_N = kQ/L^2.
Electric field E_M points from M to B, and E_N points from B to N.
Angle between E_M and E_N is 120 degrees as M, N, and B form an equilateral triangle.
Components of E_M along x-axis and y-axis are E_{Mx} = kQ/(2L^2) and E_{My} = kQ√3/(2L^2).
Components of E_N along x-axis and y-axis are E_{Nx} = -kQ/(2L^2) and E_{Ny} = kQ√3/(2L^2).
Resultant x-component of electric field is E_{Bx} = 0.
Resultant y-component of electric field is E_{By} = kQ√3/L^2.
Magnitude of resultant electric field at B is E_B = kQ√3/L^2.
Electric force F on a charge q in an electric field E is F = qE.
Electric force on the ball at B is F = qE_B = kQq√3/L^2.
Magnitude of the electric force experienced by the small ball at point B is kQq√3/L^2.
